oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fentress County Draft Board meets with families

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Men; Women; Soldiers; Heroes; Families; Porches; Government officials
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Butler, George Hilton, 1898-1970; Fentress County (Tenn.); World War, 1939-1945 -- Tennessee -- History; United States -- Selective Service System
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Fentress County Draft Board meets with two families. In the photo are Major Hilton Butler (seated on porch) and Sergeant Alvin C. York (making gestures with his hand).
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee. Dept. of Conservation
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: During World War II, York served as Chairman of the Fentress County Draft Board, signed up with the Signal Corps and the Tennessee State Guard, and took part in bond tours, recruitment drives, and camp inspections.
